title: Smart Diesel 70mpg in the US
body: <p>I can't wait, $13K brand new, and it gets 70mpg.  Not to mention the other <a href="http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.10/microcar.html?pg=3&amp;topic=microcar&amp;topic_set=" title="0 to 60: Yes">sweet features</a>.  <a href="http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.10/microcar.html" title="It's cute, tiny, and plastic. The kids love it (especially in Europe). It also gets 70 miles per gallon, and you can fit three side by side in a standard parking spot. Move over, Mini: The Smart microcar could be the next big thing on America's roads.">Wired</a> and <a href="http://www.gizmodo.com/archives/diesel-smart-car-coming-to-us-023965.php" title="Diesel Smart Car Coming to US">Gizmodo</a> have write-ups, and <a href="http://www.smart.com" title="Smart is S-M-R-T">Smart's site</a> is pretty decent, but their <a href="http://usa.smart.com/brand/media/stage.html" title="i hate flash">fluffy US site</a> could use some work.  Of course in order to import their cars into the US, they had to make an SUV version (according to unwritten law).</p>
